fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-61356].
  {panel}

h3. Summary
using the keyboard shortcut "g + i" for "Find Issue" / "Go to Issue Navigator" no longer works. 

Additionally, the "g + p" shortcut to go to the browse project page is also broken.

h3. Environment
* JIRA Cloud
* Tested on:
** Chrome Version 50.0.2661.102 (64-bit)
** Chrome Version 51.0.2704.84 (64-bit)
** Firefox 46.0.1
** Firefox 47.0
 
h3. Steps to Reproduce
# us the keyboard short cut "g" then "i" 
## as listed under the ? dropdown >> Keyboard Shortcuts

h3. Expected Results
Navigates to Issue navigator:
- {{https://<INSATNCE_NAME>.atlassian.net/issues/?jql=}}

h3. Actual Results
URL is update to add # at the end and no navigation occurs

Exe:
- page 
-- {{https://<Instance_URL>.atlassian.net/secure/Dashboard.jspa}}
- Updates to:
-- {{https://<Instance_URL>.atlassian.net/secure/Dashboard.jspa#}}
 
h3.Workaround
Manually navigate to issue navigator via
- Issues Dropdown
- Search for issue
fields.summary: the hotkey g + i for "find issue" does not navigate to Issue navigator
Missing description of priority in /search resource

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-61354].
  {panel}

h3. Problem definition
Today, there's no complete list of IP address ranges documented by Atlassian. We have to use network analysis tools to investigate outgoing connections made by UPM, and keep the rules updated from time to time.

h3. Suggestion
An official documentation of IP address ranges
fields.summary: As an admin, I would like to refer to an official list of IP addresses to be whitelisted for configuring firewall whitelisting

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-61350].
  {panel}

h3. Summary
[Installing JIRA data center|https://confluence.atlassian.com/jira/installing-jira-data-center-604274940.html] has instuctions on how to upgrade yoru existing JIRA Instance to data center.  It does not document where the licence change occurs.
h3. Environment
* Currently running JIRA Server.
* Upgrading JIRA to Data Center.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Follow instructions in [Installing JIRA data center|https://confluence.atlassian.com/jira/installing-jira-data-center-604274940.html].  Go to Section 3 Configure your existing JIRA instance to work in a cluster.
# A restart in this section is implied.
# After restart, a screen is displayed that shows when to enter in the licence.
# Then the screen directs another reboot.

h3. Expected Results
These are the expected results.

h3. Actual Results
The actual results are that if someone is planning an upgrade to Data Center, the point where the licence change is not straightforward.

The Data Center licences is rejected when running JIRA as a standalone instance.  

A note about these screens, and directly calling these instructions as migration instructions, would mitigate customer confusion and assist in training new agents. 

h3.Workaround
The workaround is to follow the instructions without knowing the expected results.
fields.summary: Documentation does not state where licence change happens

I can see this on my issue:

However, I'm not allowed to see this page:

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-61345].
  {panel}

h3. Problem Definition
Currently in JIRA UI as well as JIRA logs *SocketTimeoutExeception: read timed out* if user wrongly selected SMTP protocol instead of SECURE_SMTP protocol when configuring SMTP in JIRA.
!smtp.png|thumbnail!

h3. Suggested Solution
A better error message such as _you have choose a wrong protocol for this port_ or similar would be better instead of SocketTimeoutExeception: read timed out error as it is confusing at users end.
fields.summary: Misleading Error When Wrong Protocol is Selected for SMTP Configuration

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-61344].
  {panel}

h3. Problem Definition
Users would like to have the ability to change the rss feeds language into English instead of the system default langauge. This is due to some issues faced when exporting rss feed (for fitlers etc.), as some emails such as outlook are not able to interpret certain languages. 

h3. Suggested Solution
Provide the users with the ability to configure the RSS feed language as preferred.
fields.summary: Ability to change the RSS feed language

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-61343].
  {panel}

h3. Problem Definition
When importing a *CSV* file, if there are users under the *Watchers* field who *do not* exist in JIRA, they will *not* be imported. The user must be available in JIRA before you can import them as a watcher on a specific issue. 

The Documentation does not provide any information regarding this matter to clarify whether this is *expected* behavior or not.

h3. Suggested Solution
Provide documentation that states the reason behind this behavior and details regarding the actual expected behavior.
fields.summary: Watchers are not created in JIRA after a CSV import
Make pretty rendering of issue links configurable

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-61340].
  {panel}

h3. Summary

In [Configuring attachment settings|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/AdminJIRAServer071/Configuring+file+attachments] screen in the product, there is the description saying "The total upload size limit of attachments." in *Attachment Size* field.
 !configure-attachment-size.png|thumbnail! 

First we think "The total upload size" means the total size limit of attachments per issue literally. But this is actually for setting max file size per attachment. This description is really misleading.

h3. Environment
(Optional - If Applicable)
* Any environment as this appears as application message in product UI

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Choose the cog icon in header,  then choose "System" under "JIRA ADMINISTRATION "
# Choose "Attachements" in the left-hand panel.
# You can see the description "The total upload size limit of attachments." in "Attachment Size" field, and the default value is set as 10.00 MB.
# When upload attachement files in a issue, I can upload many files with size 5MB, 6MB, 9.9MB. But I cannot upload a file over 10.00MB. So it's not right what "The total upload size" at 3. 

h3. Expected Results

The description at 3 should be corrected like "The upload size limit of an attachment." 
Or JIRA user should be able to upload attachments  files up to 10MB per issue. 

h3. Actual Results

JIRA user can upload many files over 10MB unless each attachiment file is not over 10MB.
 
h3. Notes

Need to confirm the original specification.

h3.Workaround
fields.summary: Description of Attachement Size filed in configuring attachement UI  is misleading

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-61339].
  {panel}

h3. Summary
IndexRecoveryLauncher has a problem with timestamps where it will reindex every time even though the logs indicate the timestamp is exactly the same between Lucene and the DB

h3. Steps to Reproduce
1. Restart JIRA

h3. Expected Results
1. A log message will appear with "Latest index date: {timestamp}, Latest DB date: {timestamp}"
2. With the timestamp being the same no reindex will take place.

h3. Actual Results
1. The timestamps will be the same and then the logs will output "Recover Issue Index - start"

h3.Workaround
There is no workaround as of now
fields.summary: IndexRecoveryLauncher reindexes everytime at startup

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-61338].
  {panel}

h3. Summary

File uploads as temporary attachment multiple times while user holding Ctrl-V
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Open issue page
 # Ctrl-C any file on your drive
 # Ctrl-V it on issue page and hold Ctrl-V for a while

h3. Expected Results

File attached as temporary attachment once
h3. Actual Results

As long hold Ctrl-V file is uploading multiple times as temporary attachment

 
h3. Notes

(!) Problem of adding multiple attachments in Firefox while _dragging_ the file over the drop area was tracked as JRA-63219 and is now fixed. Please see the issue comments for the details.
fields.summary: File uploads as temporary attachment multiple times while user holding Ctrl-V

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-61334].
  {panel}

h3. Problem Definition

Per [JIRA Documentation Directory|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/ALLDOC/JIRA+Documentation+Directory], XML Exports of the JIRA Documentation used to be available until JIRA 7, which allowed for importing to a local Confluence instance. This was useful for cases such as offline JIRA instances which cannot access the documentation through the internet.

As of JIRA 7, these XML Exports are no longer being produced.

h3. Suggested Solution

Continue offering XML Exports for JIRA 7.x.x+.
fields.summary: Create XML Export of Local Documentation for JIRA 7
Notification within JIRA when issue is commented by the customer.
Ability to remove status from active workflow

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-61330].
  {panel}

h3. Summary

After changing the *Menu Item Highlight Text Color*	in the [Look and Feel|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/AdminJIRACloud/Configuring+the+look+and+feel+of+your+JIRA+applications] settings in JIRA, when selecting an assignee from an issue, the highlighted text is still the default color (white) for the unbolded characters. 

h3. Environment
Tested on JIRA Server 7.1.6

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Go to the Look and Feel settings.
# Change the Menu Item Highlight Text Color to something other than white ex. Green.
# Create/go to a ticket.
# Try to switch the assignee from the Assign button or edit the assignee field.

h3. Expected Results
The entire username string will be in the same color as what was configured in the Look and Feel settings.

h3. Actual Results
Only the bolded part of the username will be in the new color, the unbolded characters still remain white.
 
h3. Notes
This does not happen when trying to pick assignee when searching through JQL and also when attempting to mention a user.
fields.summary: Menu Item Highlight Text Color does not change highlighted text color when selecting an Assignee.

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-61328].
  {panel}

h3. Problem Definition
The "connecting JIRA to SQL Server" documentations do not mention the autoCommit parameter in the JDBC URLs. This parameter is needed to prevent deadlocks as per https://confluence.atlassian.com/jirakb/deadlock-when-running-jira-with-sql-server-283640022.html and so it should be a required configuration in JIRA's dbconfig.xml.

h3. Suggested Solution
Modify the documentation to include {{autoCommit=false}} parameter by default:
https://confluence.atlassian.com/jira063/connecting-jira-to-sql-server-2012-683541742.html
https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRA064/Connecting+JIRA+to+SQL+Server+2008
fields.summary: Documentation for SQL Server should include setting the autoCommit parameter in JDBC URL

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-61320].
  {panel}

h3. Steps to reproduce
# Hide the Components field in the field configuration for any given project.
# Go to the project's admin > Components page.
# Add a component.
# Refresh the page.

h3. Expected results
The component added in step 3 above is still there.

h3. Actual results
JIRA says "You haven't added any components to this project yet". If you try to add the component again, JIRA says it already exists.

h3. Notes
The component is successfully added with a {{POST}} to {{/rest/api/2/component}}, but then immediately does a {{GET}} to {{/rest/projects/1.0/project/<key>/component/<component id>}} which returns 404.
fields.summary: Hiding Components field in field configuration breaks Components page in project admin

fields.description:

h3. Summary
Any file attached with Ctrl+V is being converted to png

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Step 1 Ctrl-C any file on your drive
# Step 2 Ctrl-V it on issue page

h3. Expected Results
file is attached as is

h3. Actual Results
Image file converted to png and attached / Empty error message for non-image files

h3.Workaround
The issue is only with Ctrl+V attachments, use any other method to attach file.
fields.summary: Any file attached with Ctrl+V is being converted to png

When a story or defect gets moved from one project(A) to another project(B), the sprint from A project also gets moved to the B project, and if that sprint in A project gets closed, then there is no option to remove that in B project.

h3. Problem Definition
When JIRA is trying to write to a file on the file system and does not have sufficient permissions to do so, then it logs a very generic message in the logs : 
{noformat}2016-06-02 19:39:58,969 lexorank-executor-thread-0 ERROR      [service.lexorank.balance.LexoRankBalancingService] java.io.IOException: No such file or directory
java.lang.IllegalStateException: java.io.IOException: No such file or directory
	at net.java.ao.db.FileSystemUtils$1.get(FileSystemUtils.java:43)
	at net.java.ao.db.FileSystemUtils$1.get(FileSystemUtils.java:24)
	at com.google.common.base.Suppliers$MemoizingSupplier.get(Suppliers.java:109)
	at net.java.ao.db.FileSystemUtils.isCaseSensitive(FileSystemUtils.java:50)
	at net.java.ao.db.MySQLDatabaseProvider.isCaseSensitive(MySQLDatabaseProvider.java:189)
.
.
Caused by: java.io.IOException: No such file or directory
	at java.io.UnixFileSystem.createFileExclusively(Native Method)
	at java.io.File.createTempFile(Unknown Source)
	at java.io.File.createTempFile(Unknown Source)
	at net.java.ao.db.FileSystemUtils$1.get(FileSystemUtils.java:29)
	... 84 more{noformat}

h3. Suggested Solution
It would be nice if JIRA adds more information on the path where this action is failing. That would help administrators troubleshoot the problem on their own without even contacting Support.

  {panel}

The defect is reproduced on Jira Server 6.3.12, 6.3.14 and 6.4.6. 
Browser Chrome.

Steps to reproduce (should be done +without page refresh+):
# Open an issue in editable status
# Edit Description field via inline editing and save changes
# Transition the issue to non-editable status (prorerty "jira.issue.editable" is set to "false")
# Transition the issue back to editable status
# Try to edit Description field via inline edit

+Expected result:+ It is possible to inline edit Description field and save the changes.
+Actual result:+
* (for Jira Server 6.3.12 and 6.4.6) It is possible to inline edit Description field, but "Save" button does not work. It is possible only to cancel the changes. 
*OR* 
* (for Jira Server 6.3.14) In a very short moment Description field is cleared on its own and switches back to view mode. In issue history appears a record that the field was cleared by the user.
fields.summary: Incorrect behavior of inline editing of Description field after transition an issue from non-editable status

h3. Summary

When uploading an attachment, the generated thumbnail image does not contain EXIF information (e.g. orientation).

h3. Environment
* JIRA Cloud
* JIRA Server

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Take a photo with an iPhone in portrait mode
# Upload this photo as an attachment.

h3. Expected Results
The thumbnail contains EXIF information

h3. Actual Results
The thumbnail contains no EXIF information (note that the thumbnail of the attached photo is displayed in the incorrect orientation - if you download it and view the image on your computer, the image is displayed correctly).
 
h3. Notes
This has knock-on effects for the file viewer on mobile devices (as the aspect ratio of the thumbnail is used to display the full image, so although the full image displays in the correct orientation, it's squashed).

h3.Workaround
None
fields.summary: Attachment thumbnails do not preserve EXIF information

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-61264].
  {panel}

h3. Summary
JIRA can get into a state where most gadgets in the "Add a gadget" dialog on dashboards never load and JIRA displays a message saying "Some gadgets failed to load". Clicking the "Try again" link may or may not work.

h3. Workaround
JIRA Cloud customers should raise a support request at [support.atlassian.com|https://support.atlassian.com] and reference this bug, and the support team will restart JIRA and increase the maximum amount of memory available to it as a temporary workaround until the bug itself is fixed.

h3. Technical notes
*Current Situation*

The dashboard fetches gadgets in a two-step operation:
# Upon clicking "add gadget" the dashboard directory is loaded and filled with the contents of the call to /rest/config/1.0/directoryitems/local.json. If this call times out (60secs) a retry is available to attempt it again. This is current design and behaviour, if the timeout is reached the "Broken Pipe" exception will be logged, this is again expected behaviour.
# Also, the dashboard will attempt to fetch external gadgets at this time via a background request to /rest/config/1.0/directoryitems/external.json and will notify this to the end user via the "Not all gadgets have loaded" information box on the dashboard. This is not an error, it's normal behaviour. Having said that, getting this timeout frequently in a specific instance might be indicative of some problem in it that would need to be troubleshooted for that customer.

If the aforementioned request to fetch external gadgets times out (60 secs), then you will get the "Some gadgets failed to load" message and a prompt to try again. This is also expected behaviour from JIRA. Having said that, getting this timeout frequently in a specific instance might be indicative of some problem in it that would need to be troubleshooted for that customer. For instance, they might have too many applinks, connectivity to applinked 
instances of JIRA and Confluence might be too slow / etc...

*What can be done now?*
* We can consider bumping the Nginx timeout for these requests.
* We can / probably should consider improving the messaging in the UI, so that what is actually happening is more clear to the end-user and support. I can even spot a spelling mistake in one of the messages 

*What can be done in the longer term?*
The current fetching / retry mechanism is quite naive as it tries to fetch everything in two one-shot requests and completely fails over to retrieve anything if the request(s) fail over. This is specially hurtful when it comes to remote specs. The number of remote specs is proportional to the amount of applinked instances and it will eventually not scale and timeout more and more frequently (this is exacerbated by the overhead of fetching the data from a remote host).
We can redesign the fetching mechanism such that specs are retrieved via a "paging" sort of mechanism (say 5 specs at a time for example) to achieve scalability and reduce the incidence of time-outs.

We can profile the fetching algorithm for a given spec to understand what performance improvements can be done for this operation such that we reduce the calculation time if possible.

Furthermore, as part of other work being undertaken, we are replacing/removing the global cache that holds these gadget specs. I believe that re-architecting these fetching mechanism and the profiling described is a pre-requisite to be able to kill this cache so we need these three things to be done together at the same time.
fields.summary: Make the fetching of Gadget specs more efficient

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-61250].
  {panel}

h5.Steps to Reproduce:
# Log into JIRA
# Log out from JIRA

h5.Expected Results:
# The URL shown in the address bar does not show the {{atl_token}} value

h5.Actual Results:
# The URL shown in the address bar shows the {{atl_token}} value

h5.Impact
After checking with the security teams, this appears to be a low risk problem (as the token is invalid after logging out). However, if there are other resources where {{atl_token}} is used as a request parameter and a resource from an external resource is included then the referrer header will leak the token (in the request to the external resource).
fields.summary: JIRA puts a user's XSRF token in various resources.

  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-61248].
  {panel}

Hello
Many of my users would like to see their notifications from Jira itself, and stop receiving emails. 

*It only make sense to surf to a system and see your latest updates there.*

Sure, I can add the Activity Stream to the dashboard, and also the Assigned To Me gadget, and maybe a Filter Results gadget to display anything that was updated in the last day - but this is too much reading to do just to find out what actually changed or if anyone sent me a comment.

I think it would be wise to add *a visibility of the same notification mechanism*, to a gadget to be displayed on a dashboard or maybe consider adding an icon for notification (like in Facebook, or like Jitter (https://marketplace.atlassian.com/plugins/com.jitterplugin.jira.jitter-notify/server/overview) use to provide, and is not supported for jira 7.x).

Thank you
Ayelet
fields.summary: Notifications inside Jira, not in emails

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-61246].
  {panel}

h3. Summary
Creating issue links to projects for which I do not have Link Issues permissions

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create 2 projects in JIRA: project A and project B
# Project A is using default permission scheme, where Link Issues permission is set to Any Logged In user
# Project B is using a modified permission scheme where no role has the permissions to Link Issues
# Find an Issue in Project A, and link it to any issue in project B

h3. Expected Results
Either result would be expected here:
* JIRA creates the link on issue A, which is allowed per the permissions above, but does not create a link on issue in project B.
* Or JIRA warns user that a reciprocal link can't be created on Issue B due to permissions (either way when we look at Issue B, we should not see any links)

h3. Actual Results
JIRA creates the link on both issues, despite project B's permission scheme that does not allow any user to link issues
 
h3. Notes


h3.Workaround
none


h3.Original Description
{quote}
This happened in a single-server setup, I had two projects, Project A and Project B. My user only had the Link Issues permission in Project A.

I then tried to create an issue link from an issue in Project A to one in Project B which worked fine. I expected the issue link operation to fail b/c I just created an issue link on an issue of a project where I don't have the Link Issues permission. That just feels like breaking the permission restrictions.
{quote}
fields.summary: I can create issue links to projects for which I do not have Link Issues permissions

h3. Summary

When using the Excel (CSV, Current Fields) Export option, column order does not match what was selected in the WebUI and the Issue ID field is included (though it was not selected).


h3. Environment
 * JIRA v1000.25.1 Cloud


h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Perform a JIRA Issue Search
 # Configure custom Columns and Column Order
 # Export Issues to CSV using Export > Excel (CSV, Current Fields)


h3. Expected Results

Downloaded CSV file only shows Columns (and results) based on what is selected in the WebUI


h3. Actual Results

No Errors in logs.
 The IssueID field (column) is added
 Order does not keep to what was configured in the WebUI
 Shown in screenshot:

||WebUI|Issue Type, Issue Key, Summary, Assignee, Reporter, Priority, Status, Resolution, Created Date, Updated Date, Affects Version/s, Links|
||CSV Export|Summary, Issue Key, *Issue id*, Issue Type, Status, Priority, Resolution, Assignee, Reporter, Created, Updated, Outward issue link (Blocks)|

!WebvsCSV.png|thumbnail!
h3. Notes

Appears that the Excel (CSV) Export options were added in April 19th but listed as a Service Desk Feature: [https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/Cloud/What's+New#What'sNew-servicedesk|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/Cloud/What's+New#What%27sNew-servicedesk]
h3. Workaround

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-61186].
  {panel}

*Problem Definition*

Latest dbconfig.xml for MySQL looks like below:

{code:java}
<jira-database-config>
  <name>defaultDS</name>
  <delegator-name>default</delegator-name>
  <database-type>mysql</database-type>
  <jdbc-datasource>
    <url>jdbc:mysql://localhost:3306/jiradb7010?useUnicode=true&characterEncoding=UTF8&sessionVariables=storage_engine=InnoDB</url>
    <driver-class>com.mysql.jdbc.Driver</driver-class>
    <username>root</username>
    <password>xxxxxxxxxx</password>
    <pool-min-size>20</pool-min-size>
    <pool-max-size>20</pool-max-size>
    <pool-max-wait>30000</pool-max-wait>
    <validation-query>select 1</validation-query>
    <min-evictable-idle-time-millis>60000</min-evictable-idle-time-millis>
    <time-between-eviction-runs-millis>300000</time-between-eviction-runs-millis>
    <pool-max-idle>20</pool-max-idle>
    <pool-remove-abandoned>true</pool-remove-abandoned>
    <pool-remove-abandoned-timeout>300</pool-remove-abandoned-timeout>
    <pool-test-while-idle>true</pool-test-while-idle>
    <validation-query-timeout>3</validation-query-timeout>
  </jdbc-datasource>
</jira-database-config>
{code}

While validation query is set here, there's no <pool-test-on-borrow> set to false line. This will cause Health Checker plugin to throw error below:

"The database configuration 'pool-test-on-borrow' is not set as per our recommended settings."

*Suggested Solution*

Add <pool-test-on-borrow>false</pool-test-on-borrow> line in the dbconfig.xml when instance with MySQL database is created.

*Workaround*

Add the <pool-test-on-borrow>false</pool-test-on-borrow> line to the dbconfig.xml manually and restart JIRA to resolve the Health Checker error.
fields.summary: MySQL Pool Test Borrow error

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-61176].
  {panel}

While getting from the REST API route: /rest/api/2/issue/createmeta?expand=projects.issuetypes.fields
The response we received is a malformed JSON that appears to be truncated arbitrarily, always at the same position.

Due to privacy concerns, we're not able to provide an example of the output. However we'll explain how to replicate this problem.

h4. Preconditions
Use a JIRA instance hosted on atlassian.net

h4. Examples
h5. Not working calls
{quote}
curl -X "GET" "https://subdomain.atlassian.net/rest/api/2/issue/createmeta?expand=projects.issuetypes.fields" \
-H "Accept-Encoding: gzip" \
-H "Authorization: JWT /TOKEN/" \
 --compressed

curl -X "GET" "https://subdomain.atlassian.net/rest/api/2/issue/createmeta?expand=projects.issuetypes.fields" \
-H "Authorization: JWT /TOKEN/" \
 --compressed

curl -X "GET" "https://subdomain.atlassian.net/rest/api/2/issue/createmeta?expand=projects.issuetypes.fields" \
-H "Authorization: JWT /TOKEN/" {quote}

All those calls will return an invalid JSON response as it is truncated.

h5. Working Calls
{quote}
curl -X "GET" "https://subdomain.atlassian.net/rest/api/2/issue/createmeta?expand=projects.issuetypes.fields" \
-H "Accept-Encoding: gzip
" \
-H "Authorization: JWT /TOKEN/" \
 --compressed

curl -i -X "GET" "https://subdomain.atlassian.net/rest/api/2/issue/createmeta?expand=projects.issuetypes.fields" \
-H "Accept-Encoding: foo
" \
-H "Authorization: JWT /TOKEN/" {quote}

*Notice that the working calls have a line break in the content of the Accept-Encoding header. *

The token used comes from an Atlassian Connect application. An anonymous request (No authorization header) won't truncate the response.

This needs to be investigated. How can we help?
fields.summary: Createmeta API response truncated and malformed

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-61158].
  {panel}

h3. Summary

If a user shares a filter or dashboard with a group, it must be a part of that group. However, if after sharing with the group, the user is removed from the group, or if the group is deleted in User Management, this user can no longer edit the filter.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create a user and a group and add the user to the group
# Log in as this user
# Create any filter or dashboard as this user
# Share the filter/dashboard with the created group
# Remove user from the group or delete the group in User Management
# Find the filter in ‘My Filters’ or the dashboard in 'Manage Dashboards' and click it
# Edit its JQL and carry out the search again
# Click ‘Save’
# Or try to edit the Dashboard and click on 'Update'

h3. Expected Results
The user is still able to edit the filter/dashboard.

h3. Actual Results
The filter is actually not saved with this error:
{noformat}
The filter My Filter could not be saved.
{noformat}

This appears in the browser’s JavaScript Console:
{noformat}
batch.js?agile_global_admin_condition=true&atlassian.aui.raphael.disabled=true&is-system-admin=true…:3875 PUT https://instance.atlassian.net/rest/api/2/filter/10100?expand=subscriptions[-5:] 400 ()
{noformat}

The user won't be able to edit the Dashboard and also, the *Add Gadgets* and *Edit Layout* buttons won't display for the user.
 
h3. Notes
There’s a similar problem here:
https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRA-59185

h3.Workaround
h4. Workaround 1
Delete the share with that group:
# Find the filter in ‘My Filters’
# Click ‘cog icon’ >> ‘Edit’
#* You’ll see this error:
{noformat}
You do not have permission to share with Group: ‘mygroup’.
{noformat}
# Remove the group by clicking the ‘trash can icon’ next to it
# Click ‘Save’

h4. Workaround 2
Add the user back to the group. (this may cause changes in permission for this user, make sure to check this first).

h4. Workaround 3 - Applicable only for Dashboards
Delete the groups that were previously deleted from the 'User Management' from the *Edit and share dashboard* page.
fields.summary: Cannot save/edit filter/dashboard if user is removed from group shared in filter/dashboard

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-61157].
  {panel}

Currently, the JIRA Core Server Documentation on [Linking issues|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRACORESERVER071/Linking+issues#Linkingissues-CreatingalinktoaConfluencepage], makes no reference to the following:
- How to navigate to the Issue linking page
- How to edit, delete, or create a new issue link type

Looking at our [documentation|https://confluence.atlassian.com/jira063/configuring-issue-linking-683542594.html] pre JIRA 7 this information was documented before:
{quote}Adding a link type
To create a new link type, e.g. 'Causes':
Log in as a user with the JIRA Administrators global permission.
Choose  > System. Select Issue Features > Issue Linking to open the Issue Linking page.
(tick) Keyboard shortcut: g + g + start typing issue linking
In the 'Add New Link Type' form at the end of the page:
Enter 'Causes' in the Name text field.
Enter 'causes' in the Outward Link Description text field.
Enter 'is caused by' in the Inward Link Description text field.
Click the Add button.
This returns to the Issue Linking page, with a new section listing the Causes link type.
{quote}

Our current documentation should be updated to include details on how to navigate to the Issue linking page as well as how to create a new issue link type.
fields.summary: Update Linking issues documentation to include issue link type details

  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-61140].
  {panel}

In JIRA 7.1.x you are unable to perform a search against the assignee field using the WAS operator and full name e.g. assignee WAS "Homer Simpson".  

Customers report that as of JIRA 6.4.12 you could perform a search similar to project = PRJ AND assignee was "Homer Simpson" and the documentation included an example of this:  https://confluence.atlassian.com/jira063/advanced-searching-683542528.html#AdvancedSearching-WAS

The [7.1 Advanced searching - operators reference|https://confluence.atlassian.com/jirasoftwareserver071/advanced-searching-operators-reference-800707158.html#Advancedsearching-operatorsreference-WASWAS] does not include references to using the full name. 

The [Advanced searching - fields reference for 7.1|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRASOFTWARESERVER071/Advanced+searching+-+fields+reference] states you can perform a search against the assignee field using WAS and provides an example

If the intended functionality is not to allow the WAS operator to search by full name in the assignee field can we make the documentation consistent.  If not, please advise.

Thanks,

Branden
fields.summary: Conflicting documentation regarding searching assignee by Full Name using WAS operator

{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-61134].
  {panel}

Hi Atlassian!

I am the developer of the Table Grid Editor add-on (https://marketplace.atlassian.com/plugins/com.idalko.jira.plugins.igrid/server/overview).
I am using custom field default value as a storage for a grid configuration. It can be quite large depending on the number of columns in the grid. Some customers report that they are getting error on saving of the custom field default value on the JIRA instances which use Oracle database. I checked it and noticed, that XMLVALUE column of the GENERICCONFIGURATION table that is used for this purpose has extremely short length(4000) whereas in other databases there is no limit at all on this column.

As the result some of our customers experience inconvenience working with Table Grid Editor on Oracle. Can you expand the length of the column or remove the limit at all in future versions?
fields.summary: Increase the length of the XMLVALUE column in GENERICCONFIGURATION table

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-61132].
  {panel}

h4. Problem
The  [Migrating JIRA applications to another server|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/AdminJIRAServer071/Migrating+JIRA+applications+to+another+server] article does not explicitly mention porting over the SSL keystore. If the keystore is not migrated to the new server/installation folder, the application and service integrations that use SSL will break.

h4. Suggestion
Please mention that the [truststore|https://confluence.atlassian.com/jira/connecting-to-ssl-services-117455.html] has to be migrated/merged over to the new installation, to avoid problems during/after server migration.
fields.summary: Documentation request: Keystore migration to new installation
